title: GaussianFlowOcc: Sparse and Weakly Supervised Occupancy Estimation using Gaussian Splatting and Temporal Flow
author: Simon Boeder (Bosch Research), Fabian Gigengack (Bosch Research), Benjamin Risse (University of Munster), ...
background: Occupancy estimation aims to accurately determine 3D representations of environments based on images, crucial for autonomous driving applications.
contribution: This paper introduces GaussianFlowOcc to solve the challenge of weakly supervised occupancy estimation, achieving a speedup of 50 times over previous methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied heavily on dense voxel grids and required expensive 3D annotations for training, leading to high computational costs.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by using a sparse 3D Gaussian representation and a Gaussian Transformer architecture, eliminating the need for dense voxel representations.

key_innovation: The method uniquely integrates Gaussian Splatting and a Temporal Module to estimate dynamic scene occupancy while employing weak supervision.
real_world_impact: This research potentially enhances occupancy estimation in autonomous driving systems, improving safety and efficiency. Its efficient framework allows for scalable applications in real-time environments.

new_terms.Gaussian Splatting: **Gaussian Splatting** refers to a technique that represents 3D scenes using a collection of Gaussian distributions which offers a more efficient means of capturing spatial data.
new_terms.Temporal Module: **Temporal Module** signifies a component that models motion across time increments to mitigate inaccuracies due to object movement in a scene.

open_sourcing: The source will be made available under https://github.com/boschresearch/GaussianFlowOcc
